He.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a red-orange glow when placed in a high-voltage electric field
He.name: Helium

Ne.appearance: colorless gas exhibiting an orange-red glow when placed in a high voltage electric field
Ne.name: Neon

P.appearance: colourless, waxy white, yellow, scarlet, red, violet, black
P.name: Phosphorus

Ar.appearance: colorless gas exhibiting a lilac/violet glow when placed in a high voltage electric field
Ar.name: Argon

Fe.appearance: lustrous metallic with a grayish tinge
Fe.name: Iron

Ni.appearance: lustrous, metallic, and silver with a gold tinge
Ni.name: Nickel

Se.appearance: black, red, and gray (not pictured) allotropes
Se.name: Selenium

Kr.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a whitish glow in a high electric field
Kr.name: Krypton

I.appearance: lustrous metallic gray, violet as a gas
I.name: Iodine

Xe.appearance: colorless gas, exhibiting a blue glow when placed in a high voltage electric field
Xe.name: Xenon

Rn.appearance: colorless gas, occasionally glows green or red in discharge tubes
Rn.name: Radon

Pu.appearance: silvery white, tarnishing to dark gray in air
Pu.name: Plutonium

Cm.appearance: silvery metallic, glows purple in the dark
Cm.name: Curium
